our papers

  1. Fan, J. E., Hutchinson, J. B., & Turk-Browne, N. B. (2016). When past is present: Substitutions of long-term memory for sensory evidence in perceptual judgments. Journal of Vision, 16(8), 1–1.
  2. Fan, J. E., & Turk-Browne, N. B. (2016). Incidental biasing of attention from visual long-term memory. Journal of Experimental Psychology: Learning, Memory, and Cognition, 42(6), 970.
  3. Fan, J. E., Turk-Browne, N. B., & Taylor, J. A. (2016). Error-driven learning in statistical summary perception. Journal of Experimental Psychology: Human Perception and Performance, 42(2), 266.
  4. Fan, J. E. (2015). Drawing to learn: How producing graphical representations enhances scientific thinking. Translational Issues in Psychological Science, 1(2), 170.
  5. Fan, J. E., & Suchow, J. W. (2014). The crowd is self-aware. Behavioral and Brain Sciences, 37(1), 81–82.
  6. Fan, J. E., & Turk-Browne, N. B. (2013). Internal attention to features in visual short-term memory guides object learning. Cognition, 129(2), 292–308.
  7. Fan, J. E. (2013). Can ideas about food inspire real social change? The case of Peruvian gastronomy. Gastronomica: The Journal of Food and Culture, 13(2), 29–40.
  8. Strange, B. A., Kroes, M. C., Fan, J., & Dolan, R. J. (2010). Emotion causes targeted forgetting of established memories. Frontiers in Behavioral Neuroscience, 4, 175.
  9. Sharot, T., Shiner, T., Brown, A. C., Fan, J., & Dolan, R. J. (2009). Dopamine enhances expectation of pleasure in humans. Current Biology, 19(24), 2077–2080.
